text: Hello :wave:  I’m Fio, I’m the Senior Editor (Brand) at <http://Hotjar.com|Hotjar.com> and I’m an avid over-user of em dashes. You might see me use them a lot in the future—I like to think they add flair to the written word. Looking forward to having content-related fun with you all!

elements.text: Hello
I’m Fio, I’m the Senior Editor (Brand) at
Hotjar.com
and I’m an avid over-user of em dashes. You might see me use them a lot in the future—I like to think they add flair to the written word. Looking forward to having content-related fun with you all!

text: hi, what Senior Editor (Brand) does in real, practical examples?

elements.text: and nice to meet you!

text:
Hello Radek! I’m not sure the job description is universal—but at Hotjar in particular, the Senior Editor (Brand):
• Owns the company’s style guides, tone of voice, and writing frameworks
• Works with the Brand team to generate creative/storytelling concepts
• Trains/coaches in-house writers 
• Edits… a lot :wink:

elements.text: Hello Radek! I’m not sure the job description is universal—but at Hotjar in particular, the Senior Editor (Brand):
Owns the company’s style guides, tone of voice, and writing frameworks
Works with the Brand team to generate creative/storytelling concepts
Trains/coaches in-house writers
Edits… a lot

text: thanks, really helpful. Does that mean, for example, you create such style guide and later chase people who are not relying on them? or do you work with copywriters who are creating new collateral, like ads?

elements.text: thanks, really helpful. Does that mean, for example, you create such style guide and later chase people who are not relying on them? or do you work with copywriters who are creating new collateral, like ads?

text: both — I create and maintain the style guide, for example, and I train people to use it… but then I don’t really chase anyone :wink: I trust the process & the people involved. And yes, I work  with in-house writers but also external freelance writers/copywriters when needed

elements.text: both — I create and maintain the style guide, for example, and I train people to use it… but then I don’t really chase anyone

text: Can we start an em dash fan club?? I also love when people know how to use en dashes properly. Are any of you in any copyediting organizations like <http://aceseditors.org|aceseditors.org>?

text: <@U016VHZ0ZD5> I am not, actually. Anything you’d recommend?

elements.text: I am not, actually. Anything you’d recommend?

text: <@U017WRJTKF1> I'm in ACES, which focuses on both in-house and freelance editing. It's great! They offer a lot of educational material, and their annual conference is where the major English dictionaries and style books reveal their most controversial updates—so you get to be in the room for the collective gasp when AP does something wild like change their entry on "percent" to "%" :laughing:

elements.text: I'm in ACES, which focuses on both in-house and freelance editing. It's great! They offer a lot of educational material, and their annual conference is where the major English dictionaries and style books reveal their most controversial updates—so you get to be in the room for the collective gasp when AP does something wild like change their entry on "percent" to "%"

text: <@U017WRJTKF1> I've also met so many editor friends through it. A lot of us are still active on Twitter

text: Hi everyone! :man_dancing::skin-tone-3: My name is Emerline. I’m the Head of Brand Communications at <https://creativemornings.com/|CreativeMornings>. I took over this position a year ago after a background in PR and Partnerships Strategy. It took some warming up, but thanks to Superpath and other resources — I think I’ve finally wrapped my brain around this thing called content marketing… and I’m so excited! I feel like I’ve found “my people” in a way. Excited to be here, connect, and to learn alongside everyone. Please feel free to say hi either here or on <https://twitter.com/emerlineji|Twitter>! :slightly_smiling_face:

elements.text: Hi everyone!
My name is Emerline. I’m the Head of Brand Communications at
CreativeMornings

. I took over this position a year ago after a background in PR and Partnerships Strategy. It took some warming up, but thanks to Superpath and other resources — I think I’ve finally wrapped my brain around this thing called content marketing… and I’m so excited! I feel like I’ve found “my people” in a way. Excited to be here, connect, and to learn alongside everyone. Please feel free to say hi either here or on
Twitter

text: Hey hey everyone! I’m currently a marketing specialist at D. R. Horton (homebuilder) and Ive worked in the digital marketing field since 2013. I’ve been able to grow my skills in several different areas in each of my roles, while also discovering which ones I love and want to work towards. My goal is to work in a content focused role for a tech company. So until then, I am here to learn as much as I can from people with different experiences than me.

elements.text: Hey hey everyone! I’m currently a marketing specialist at D. R. Horton (homebuilder) and Ive worked in the digital marketing field since 2013. I’ve been able to grow my skills in several different areas in each of my roles, while also discovering which ones I love and want to work towards. My goal is to work in a content focused role for a tech company. So until then, I am here to learn as much as I can from people with different experiences than me.
